thread.title: Conway Christian athletes place high in 2A state tennis
thread.title_full: Conway Christian athletes place high in 2A state tennis

author: Staff
title: Conway Christian athletes place high in 2A state tennis
text:
Conway Christian athletes place high in 2A state tennis Posted: October 24, 2015 - 12:26pm Photos Conway Christian's tennis team won district titles and advanced to the 2A state tournament. Members are: Front row (L-R): Macey Vaught, Shelby Bradley, Mary-Morgan Ellis, Caroline Henley, Katherine Huff, Allyson Oliver. Back row (L-R): Tyler Gum, Winston Strawn, Zach Ward, Hunter Tollett, Marc Cochran, Scott Austin. SUBMITTED PHOTO Log Cabin Democrat 
LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
Conway Christianâ€™s doubles team of Mary Morgan-Ellis and Macey Vaught finished third in Class 2A girls doubles and the boys finished fourth overall last week in the state tennos tournament at the Fort Smith Athletic Club. 
Ellis and Vaught, who had a bye in the first round, breezed through their quarterfinal match, defeating Jones/Patterson from Hampton 6-0, 6-1. They then fell to Brickel/Milligan from Riverside 7-6, 6-4. Ellis and Vaught came back strong in the consolation finals defeating Warnock/Winsor from Union Christian 6-1, 6-3, to take third. 
In the boys singles division, CCS sophomore Winston Strawn improved his finish from last year and placed fourth. After getting a walkover in the first round when his opponent withdrew, Strawn defeated Evan Still from Western Grove, 6-4, 6-4. Strawn defeated Evan Still from Western Grove 6-4, 6-4. In the semifinals, Strawn was knocked out by the eventual champion, Grant Mason, from Riverside in a three-set match. Strawn lost in the consolation final to then faced another tough three-set fight in the consolation finals, eventually falling to Nick Grice from Western Grove to finish fourth. 
Also in state doubles play, CCS seniors Marc Cochran and Scott Austin were taken down in the first round by the eventual state runners-up, Overman/Baker from Riverside. In the girls doubles division, Sophomore Allyson Oliver and Freshman Katherine Huff were defeated in the first round by the team of Beach/Fisher from Riverside.
